posts.post_content:
In most cases, graft is more powerful, but spikes can place their counters on creatures (or animated lands) after they've come into play.  
  
They also work really well together if you have a [doubling season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=doubling season). You can remove one counter and target either another spike or itself to place 2 counters on it.
posts.html:
In most cases, graft is more powerful, but spikes can place their counters on creatures (or animated lands) after they've come into play.

They also work really well together if you have a doubling season. You can remove one counter and target either another spike or itself to place 2 counters on it.

posts.post_content: Instead of arguing about how Spike > Graft or the other way around, why not use both? All Spikes have the ability to utilize +1/+1 counters on them and Graft is good at pass them around and provide abilities (like the Plaxcaster Frogling). They make good combos together.
posts.html:
